title: The Best Ways to Remove Google Search Suggestions on Android & iOS

steps.title: Open the Google app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Google app on your phone or tablet. It's the multicolored "G" icon in your Android, iPhone, or iPad's app list. If you don't want Google to make predictions and recommendations based on your previous activity, you can disable personal results in search with this method. Turning off this feature in the Google app will also affect your searches everywhere else you sign into Google. If you don't want Google to autocomplete your queries with trending searches, jump down to disable trending searches .

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. Log in to your Google account if you haven’t already. Once you’re signed in, your profile picture is at the top-right corner of the screen. If you don't have a profile photo, you'll see your initials instead.

steps.title: Tap Settings from the menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings from the menu. It's the option with a gear icon near the bottom of the list.

steps.title: Select Privacy & Safety from the list.
steps.content: Select Privacy & Safety from the list. The option near the top of your screen has a shield icon with a checkmark inside of it.

steps.title: Tap Personal Results.
steps.content: Tap Personal Results . It's about a third of the way down the menu. Once you select it, it will open a new “Search personalization” page.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Personalize Search" to turn it off.
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Personalize Search" to turn it off. If the switch is on (blue), Google will try to autocomplete your searches based on your previous searches, as well as information stored from your Google account. Turn this feature off so the switch looks grayed out so you don’t see these personal recommendations. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Swipe a single search suggestion to the left to remove it.
steps.content: Swipe a single search suggestion to the left to remove it. Open the Google app and tap on the search bar. When your recent searches appear on screen, swipe left on the result you want to get rid of. Tap on the red trash can to remove the suggestion from your search history. On an Android, long-press on the search suggestion and select the “Delete” option.

steps.title: Delete your search history to remove all suggestions.
steps.content: Delete your search history to remove all suggestions. Open your Google app and tap on your profile picture in the top-right corner. Select “Search History” from the menu and then tap on the “Delete” button near the middle-left of the page. You can choose to delete your entire search history, or select searches from a specific time frame. [2] X Research source If you want suggestions and search history to automatically delete, click on the “Auto-delete” option on screen. Choose how often Google erases your searches between every 3, 18, or 36 months.

steps.title: Open the Google app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Google app on your phone or tablet. It's the multicolored "G" icon in your Android, iPhone, or iPad's app list. If you no longer want to see suggestions for popular searches when you search using the Google app, you can disable trending searches with this method. [3] X Research source Turning off this feature in the Google app will also affect your searches everywhere you sign into Google. If you use a mobile browser instead of the Google app to search the web, follow these instructions instead. If you see an inappropriate suggestion in trending searches, report it to Google .

steps.title: Tap your profile photo.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo. It's at the top-right corner of the screen. [4] X Research source If you don't have a profile photo, you'll see your initial instead.

steps.title: Tap Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings on the menu. It's the option with a gear icon near the bottom of the options. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Other Settings option.
steps.content: Tap the Other Settings option. This is at the top of the Settings menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Turn off "Autocomplete with trending searches."
steps.content: Turn off "Autocomplete with trending searches." To do this, tap the switch next to this option so it turns gray or white. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com in your mobile browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com in your mobile browser. If you're seeing suggestions for popular searches related to what you type when you search in your web browser, you can turn off trending searches with this method. If you use the Google app instead of a web browser to search, use these instructions .

steps.title: Tap the menu ☰.
steps.content: Tap the menu ☰ . It's the three horizontal lines at the top-left corner.

steps.title: Tap More Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap More Settings on the menu. A new page will open up with privacy and safety settings.

steps.title: Select Other Settings.
steps.content: Select Other Settings . Select the option at the top of the screen to change settings tabs.

steps.title: Turn off the “Autocomplete with trending searches” setting.
steps.content: Turn off the “Autocomplete with trending searches” setting. Scroll down to the bottom of the page. Tap on the switch next to the setting so it turns gray or white to disable the trending searches.

steps.title: Tap on your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap on your profile picture. Open the Google app on your phone and select your profile picture in the top-right corner. If you’re not signed in, log in to your account first to access the autofill settings.

steps.title: Select Settings from the menu.
steps.content: Select Settings from the menu. It’s the option with the gear icon near the bottom of the list.

steps.title: Choose Autofill.
steps.content: Choose Autofill . Look for the menu option that has a key next to it.

steps.title: Toggle the switches off for password, address, and payment info.
steps.content: Toggle the switches off for password, address, and payment info. Turn the 2 switches on the page off so they’re grayed out. Now, Google won’t try to automatically put your address or passwords into fillable forms.

steps.title: Long-press or swipe left on a search prediction to report it.
steps.content: Long-press or swipe left on a search prediction to report it. If you’re on Android device, hold your finger down on the inappropriate suggestion until the pop-up menu appears. Then select “Report.” On iOS, swipe to the left and click on the exclamation point symbol. Then, tap “Report” in the bottom corner. [8] X Research source Once you submit a report, Google will review the suggestion and remove it from their site if they deem it inappropriate. [9] X Research source
